p: Reporting dengue cases to the New Caledonian health authorities is required by law. Cases are defined according to following criteria [ 61]: (i) possible case: dengue clinical signs and dengue-specific-IgM positive serology outside of an epidemic period, (ii) probable case: same as possible case, but during an epidemic and (iii) confirmed case: dengue clinical signs and either dengue-PCR positivity, dengue-NS1 positivity or dengue-specific-IgM-seroconversion. Clinical signs include: headache, retro-orbital pain, joint and muscle pain, fatigue, maculo-papular rash, vomiting, limited hemorrhage [ 61]. Case numbers reported by the New Caledonian health authorities and used in this study include possible, probable and confirmed cases.
